data.text: @Outshyned @COVID19actuary @dgurdasani1 @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @AdeleGroyer @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @JosephLu2011 Itâ€™s capitalist policy to make sure everyone gets infected.
@oldo @Atipico1996 @COVID19actuary @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @AdeleGroyer @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @JosephLu2011 Yes because Meaghan is the only person who works for the UKHSA isn't she?

@LizTray @luxelayerscom @COVID19actuary @fact_covid @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @AdeleGroyer @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @JosephLu2011 We also have protection building up from so many surviving the virus, plus a virus rapidly mutating (according to Professor Sarah Gilbert) into what is, essentially, a cold.
@Outshyned @COVID19actuary @dgurdasani1 @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @AdeleGroyer @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @JosephLu2011 It's been reported that reinfections result in milder illness, generally.

@longevitymatt @ActuaryByDay @COVID19actuary @AdeleGroyer We appreciate it! Although I realise now that my original tweet was worded very unclearly. What I really wanted was stats for cases/deaths per month, to compare to previous years (age-standardised). But I'm guessing that doesn't exist.
@jennyshipway @COVID19actuary @AdeleGroyer No I have known more people than usual - and not in particularly old people either

@ok_then_20 @COVID19actuary @AdeleGroyer According to nhs primary diagnosis 3rd March. 3525 patients in for covid, 7977 patients in with a covid positive test. So that means 56% are being treated for something else. All data available on nhs website.
@Outshyned @COVID19actuary @dgurdasani1 @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @AdeleGroyer @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @JosephLu2011 You can't eliminate as has been proven everywhere that's tried to.
